Question
========
Below you can find a histogram of a measure of happiness that is created
from a random sample of 1919 residents of the Netherlands (source:
*European Social Survey, 2014*). Specifically, the respondents answered
the following question: “Taking all things together, how happy would you
say you are?”. The answer options varied from "extremely unhappy (0) to
"extremely happy" (10).  
  
![](Screen__Shot__2019-02-21__at__00.20.09.png)
  
Is the distribution of this variable right-skewed or left-skewed? What
is the relationship of the mean with the median and the mode of the
distribution?

Answerlist
----------
* The distribution is left-skewed. The mean is lower than both the mode
  and the median.
* The distribution is left-skewed. The mean is lower than the mode but
  higher than the median.
* The distribution is right-skewed. The mean is lower than the mode but
  higher than the median.
* The distribution is right-skewed. The mean is lower than both the mode
  and the median.
